ygData.subject: I will no longer post updates to this list. (txt)
ygData.msgSnippet: I d like to start off by thanking Reedo, Chet, and David for their kind words. Unfortunately far more people seem to think I am some kind of loser for trying
ygData.messageBody:
I'd like to start off by thanking Reedo, Chet, and David for their kind
words.

Unfortunately far more people seem to think I am some kind of loser for
trying tell you all that my site is out there. I was under the impression
that this mailing list was to keep people informed about EverQuest, and
particularly about Smithing.

I have decided to no longer post any messages to any boards or lists. I am
now doing this site solely for my friends and those people who manage to
find it. I am sick of people complaining about something I do for free to
help them.

If you want to be kept abreast of changes, just e-mail me saying so and I
will send an update notice directly to you.

I think the site has a lot of potential considering that all the info comes
from me, and I have no real HTML experience. (Just bought a book yesterday.)

Sorry to have bothered anyone.

Charles Adams


From: "Reedo" <reedo@...>

Personally I'm really glad that he posted his web address. He has some of
the best info on blacksmithing on the web.


>From: "Whitcraft,David" <DWHITCRAFT@...>
>
>Agreed! I like when smaller sites tell people they have updates. I don't
>like it when they flood everyone, but I've only seen 2 posts from this guy,
>and I like his site. If he gets time to work on it, it could be very very
>benificial. I've been there a couple of times, and like the info there.
>
>I've not had bad experience with people on boards, as I don't post much and
>I delete babble very quickly. *shrug* Was annoying to come into work Monday
>and have 149 new messages waiting...
>
>-Zantaer, Fennin Ro
>

>From: "Chet Watkins" <chetwatkins@...>
>
>Has everyone on this game gone postal???!!! WHO CARES!!! If he has an update
>
>to his web site and he wants to post it up here for people to check out, LET
>
>HIM!! It does deal with EQ and that should be all that really matters. I am
>seeing a bad trend on the message board and in game and it has a lot to do
>with things like this. PEOPLE ARE GETTING RUDE. I had better run ins with
>pkers on UO then with the people im seeing in EQ and the mailing list.
>Please, Everyone just sit back, relax, and enjoy the info we recieve. I know
>
>as well as anyone else reading these that your probably at work, if you
>werent you would be playing right now, so dont tell me you have something
>better to be doing then reading these posts. I'm not saying post anything
>and everything, but this mailing list has done very well about staying on
>subject, a couple of links to eq info sites is not going to kill anyone.
>
>Rant over, return to your normal blacksmithing news.
>

Xezol - Lvl 13 Gnome Mag on E'Ci

Visit My EverQuest Page; including zone maps, trade skill guides, general
